meanings.definition: An extremely large but unspecified number.
meanings.sent1: After the party, there were a jillionth of balloons left over.
meanings.sent2: She had to count a jillionth of stars in the sky for her science project.
meanings.sent3: The jillionth of cookies in the jar seemed to magically disappear overnight.
meanings.sent4: The jillionth of raindrops falling created a soothing sound on the roof.
meanings.sent5: The jillionth of grains of sand on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The ordinal number corresponding to one billionth.
meanings.sent1: In the line, he was the jillionth person waiting for the new iPhone.
meanings.sent2: She won the race by a jillionth of a second, making her the champion.
meanings.sent3: The jillionth student to arrive late had to do extra chores after school.
meanings.sent4: The jillionth place ribbon made her feel proud of her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The jillionth page of the book held the key to solving the mystery.
